comment.text:
In terms of brewpubs, this is a solid choice. The location, right off the BeltLine, is unbeatable. There are so many great things in the area and New Realm fits right in. 

We walked along the BeltLine on a Saturday and stopped in for a flight of beer and to enjoy the sunshine. 

Pros:
- Good beer (several choices, everyone can find something they like)
- Location (BeltLine adjacent)
- Price (flights and tasters were reasonable)

Cons:
- Crowds (so very busy, it was hard to find seating)
- Service (quite slow, even when at the bar)
- Beer line (the first line at the entrance is confusing, it's unclear what to do)

Overall, had a positive experience and would definitely return if in the area.

This is a great little spot. It's right off the belt line but also has plenty of parking (valet only). 

Their food is amazing. Pricey but good,  they range from $15-$26. They also have appetizers ranging from $10-$16, so it's a gear spot to beers & light apps. 

I suggest their Mac and Cheese ($11), it's a must have you you love it cheesy. It comes baked with a beautiful crust . 

We did not like their Asian-Style loaded fries ($10)- think crispy seasoned fries.  Not goey and overloaded at all plus the pork on them was dry. Their wings ($14) are just your basic bar wings. 

Overall they have a great range of beers from blondes , to sours (try the Berries & Bloom), to stouts and IPA's. Beers range from $6-$7.

Since its opening, New Realm has become a dependable staple on my rotation of local restaurants. 

The location is conveniently off the Beltline, so you can either walk right up or use their Valet in their huge parking lot located of Sommerset/Ralph McGill. 

Part of the reason I love New Realm is their ambiance- the indoor eating space is very large and comfortable, but they have several areas for patio eating that allow for great people watching, live music, and a more casual vibe. I typically bring my dog, so opt for the picnic table area that is very very very dog friendly in addition to having cornhole.

They have a rotating tap and only certain beers can be poured and specific bars at New Realm (they have two outdoor bars, a growler bar, and an upstairs bar). So either know exactly where to go for what you want, or be flexible with their options. Hoptropolis is one of my go-tos with a very citrus-froward hoppy taste. I will warn you that it does sneak up on you and may feel it more than you expect! My husband errs towards more German style beers and likes the "Munich Dunkel" as his typical order. They currently have a "Oaxaca Choca" Imperial Mexican Chocolate Stout and wow is it delicious. Most of the bartenders/servers can guide you towards an option if you are overwhelmed.

I also LOVE the food here...most of the time I'm wanting to go to New Realm for some of their Asian Loaded fries more than wanting a beer. I swear these fries are addictive with their crispy pork,siracha, and miso mayo. The pretzel is also a great appetizer for sharing. If I am feeling like eating something more, I typically get the New Realm Burger (I like the classics, what can I say). While I have my go-to order, they are wonderful about rotating the menu and trying new things. 

If you are looking for a casual place to meet up with friends, people watch, or just even eat some delicious fries, check out New Realm.

We stopped by for a quick to-go drink. This brewery is beautiful and it looks like it is a great place to hang out at any time of day. Their tap list wasn't very exciting, nothing too exotic or unique. I'm not sure what kind of clientele they are going for but I got the vibe that their tap list was geared more towards the mainstream beer drinkers and not the beer nerds. I got an IPA that was ok but not anything to write home about. I would love to check it out again so that I can write a more reflective review. Its on my to-do list next time I'm in ATL!

Came here to try the Mac and cheese, and it did not disappoint! Super cheesy and perfect portion to share. 
We also ordered a burger and a chocolate shake- SO GOOD! I would recommend making a reservation before coming, especially on a weekend, otherwise you will have a very long wait. Our food came out in a timely manner, despite how busy they were so we definitely appreciated that, and our server was very attentive and friendly. I loved the ambiance of the restaurant and it's a great location- if you walk to the back you're on the belt line and it's dog friendly on the patio. I will definitely be back!

This was our first time here! What a great place to enjoy friends and good beer. I had one of the United craft lager. That was my beer of choice last night.
They had safety measures in place, just wish the tables were wiped down more regularly. We had wipes and wiped our area down. Parking is also tight.
Next time we go, we'll try food.
Views of the city, access to the belt line and good beer. It was a great night!

photos.caption: Out for patio, perfect anytime but definitely during COVID!

comment.text:
Location. 5 stars.  right on the beltline.  near Ponce City Market

Ambiance.  5 stars.  lots of outdoor seating and a lot of fun

Beer selection.  LOTS and lots of unique things.  I tried a Pilsner that was ok, nothing great, but they had a lot with a lot of colors.  

Food.  I only got a pretzel and fries which were ok.  so really not fair to rate only 3 but that's all i have to go by.  i will go back and get more another time.

Ugh, I don't like this place. The beer is mediocre at best, drinks are watered down and overpriced, food is hit or miss. Not worth it. Other than being on the beltline, I don't know any redeeming qualities. There are so many better breweries in Atlanta that I can't imagine ever coming back here.

I had the birria tacos and they were quite tasty and I would have given 5 stars but ... the taco on the left was half stuffed (see pic) and some of the stewed beef was a little dry on the right. The flavors were great and loved the au jus sauce to dip the tacos into. To be honest I had my doubts that this would be good haha but new realm does a great job with their job and menu. The corn was flavorful as well not too salty and grilled well. The beans were great too. 

I also had some of their Buffalo wings. They nice and crispy not too spicy somewhat salty. The crisp was great, soggy wings just don't do it for me.. the wings came out hot and fresh.

I was surprised they didn't have the NFL network, would have liked to have watched TNF but it was 2 0-3 teams playing and playoff baseball was on. They have been closing at 10 pm anyways so not the most ideal spot for 8 pm games. I would definitely recommend the new birria tacos they have on the menu if you're here!

This place is the place you bring all your friends and family that's never been to Atlanta. The views of the Beltline and Atlanta is great from the rooftop. It's so big you don't have to deal with being close to people and you can enjoy a meal and beer. The Mac and cheese is amazing! Theirs something for everyone here. 
The valet is complimentary as long as you bring your receipt within an hour to them!!

Fun fact: I live literally next to New Realm, and go all the time. But until recently, I had never tried their food. 
Let me tell you, it lived up to the hype, and paired perfectly with one of their Beer Flights, featuring a Spiked Seltzer on tap! The Mac & Cheese was next level indulgent but oh so good! 
The only qualm with New Realm, is it is ALWAYS packed. But it is a social spot, so i can't fault that. 
Just know if you're going for lunch, it's definitely not a quiet lunch spot, it's a popular brewery that happens to have yummy food!

They accommodated us for a party of 5. We enjoyed the patio sitting. I had the she-crab soup with herb oil and it was so good unfortunately it didn't make it to a photo because it was gone very quickly. The "B-ATL grilled cheese" was eh okay, I wasn't a huge fan of the apple butter and the bread on the sandwich. There was great entertainment, a guy playing guitar which we tipped he was pretty great. 

The cornhole was so much fun. Our party enjoyed the game and the weather was so perfect. 

Great tourist place to go if you aren't a local. We are from Virginia Beach, VA.

photos.caption: B-ATL Grilled cheese with Caesar salad.

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you

Our Virginia Beach location is also fun to go to. Have fun

comment.text:
My friends and I checked out New Realm after walking down the Beltline from Ponce City Market. The place is relatively new and has an amazing outdoor area, which I'm assuming gets very packed when the weather is nicer. 

We were seated right away, but had to wait a long while for a server to arrive. When our server finally arrived, he took our beer orders and disappeared. We didn't see him again so we had to ask another employee to bring us water. Our waiter brought our drinks to our table and we didn't see him again until it was time for us to pay. I normally wouldn't have been bothered by the lack of attention but there weren't many other tables there.

Despite the service issues, I really enjoyed the brewery. I got a flight with four beers. There isn't a set price for the flights. Instead, each of the beers have a designated price for their 4 ounce tasters and you can build your own flight with up to 6 tasters. There were very interesting beers the day I visited, the most notable of which were the Oatmeal Stout, Oaxaca Stour, and Beluga Rose. I would suggest getting a flight to try a few different beers! 

Overall, the beer was good and New Realm is such a cool place to hang out, but I was very disappointed by the service.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the review, I am sorry service was not good. Please say hi next time you are in. I want to make sure we spoil you

comment.text:
Hello To All

I just had an amazing time at New Realm Brewing and Kevin; our waiter made it a really great experience.  His straightforward East Coast style, humor, and knowledge of the menu made it easy to order.  He also kept the energy up all evening.   

The Aubrey will be back to see you.

Came in on a Tuesday evening with my husband. Made it around 6:50 for our reservations. Sat inside. I ordered a flight and another taster. The ambiance is beautiful. Didn't take long for us to sit. Ordered the half chicken which was delicious and the corn beef egg rolls. The beer fight tasted great. Really enjoyed the Belga.
Menu prices were pretty good not too bad. So to sum everything up. Everything was great BUT our server made us have a unpleasant experience. He took forever just to take our order. And check on us.
And bring our to go box. My husband sat and waited for him to get the payment and I went to get the car from valet and still had to wait for him to come out to our car. Maybe next time it would be better the facility wasn't packed nor busy. The table next to us had great service but our server was nowhere to be found.

photos.caption: Half chicken corn succotash and potatoes house jus

owner_replies.comment:
Hi

Please send me a private message with your servers info on the receipt please. Ill make it right

comment.text: Food is very good.  Clearly they have a talented chef. She crab soup was excellent. Cuban was great. Fries seem to be breaded, which was nice.  Beer was excellent. Great environment. The only downside is the fruit flies flying around the corner of the bar where I was sitting.

LOVED the food here, which is funny because you don't go to a brewery for the food-- but it was DELISH! Beers were also great for all the people who got them! We ate here after a 4+ hour day up and down the beltline, and it was perfect. It was a Monday night, so it was more quiet when we went, but honestly nice to be able to enjoy indoor seating without too many crowds/germs. The outdoor seating was ample too; we just wanted to escape the heat. 

We ordered wood-fire pizzas and some of the sandwiches. All of them were so delicious. I wish I had taken a pic.

Wow! What an excellent place! I had the pleasure of working next door for 2 weeks and almost moved in here! I can't say anything bad about this place- the food, the decor, the ambience, the staff- and the BEER! Euphonia is some of the best tasting beer I have ever had! 

I ate almost everything on the menu, and everything I had was awesome. What do I recommend? The Burger is spectacular, the Pretzel, Poke, but the Cuban sandwich is the bomb! 

The bartenders were friendly and knew my name after a single visit- which really made me feel at home!

My favorite thing, though, was sitting upstairs on the roof deck, sipping an ice-cold draft Euphonia, watching the sun set of Atlanta- such beautiful joy- and I highly recommend it...

owner_replies.comment:
Thanks for the great review Cosmo!!!!  We hope you'll make it back for another visit

Don

comment.text:
New Realm is solid, and is clearly very popular as every time I go there or walk by it is bumping. Here are my opinions about the beer, the food, and the overall experience. 

Beer: Just ok. There are a ton of other breweries in Atlanta and in terms of how much I like their beer, New Realm is near the bottom of the list. Their beer is not *bad*, but does not stand out in the field. 

Food: Pretty good. I had the grass fed burger and it was above average. Juicy, good bun. Had it with the salad which was also pretty good for a brewpub, where I feel like salads are usually meh at best. 

Overall experience: Before COVID, this place was always SUPER crowded in the evenings, probably because it's huge and right on the Beltline. To be honest it's not my vibe since I like to hear the people I'm there with, but it's fine. I think that right now during COVID times, they at least were only doing outdoor seating the last time I went there, which is good, but the tables are unfortunately quite close together, so it didn't feel *that* safe. The whole outdoor area, despite being quite spacious, does feel quite crammed, so I don't think I'll be going again until things feel safer. 

Overall, if I'm on the Beltline and I'm craving a good burger, I might stop in. The beer isn't particularly outstanding and the seating arrangements are not as spaced out as they probably should be.
food came out too slow, also saw an unattended poop in the restroom extremely disappointed.

This brewery/restaurant has such a great vibe. We were here during trivia night, it was so busy and lively. The view was spectacular, and the beers are delicious. Didn't try any food, but I will be sure to next time! Can't wait to go back

This place is cool. Was not expecting what this place was going to be like but it was a pleasant surprise for a brewery! The building and interior a really very nice. We went here to watch a football game on Saturday and when we arrived we were told that the TVs were up on the roof. Okay... It was pretty chilly out but they said they were going to turn on the heaters and it would warm up quick.

It is a great view from the rooftop. It was mostly closed in and the heaters, wow did they warm it up up there. They had to shut most of them off after a while.

The beer was great, the food was delicious and the service was great as well. We followed Jeremy up as he was opening up upstairs. He served us our beers and we ordered some food. He turned off the music and changed every TV to the game we wanted to watch. Perfect!!

The wings, pretty much just hot wings. They were good. My daughter ordered the Spicy Korean Pork Cheek Buns, DELICIOUS! Then for lunch my wife ordered the hamburger (Radegast) I was going to order but I did not get as much help eating the wings as I expected so she split her burger with me. Damn that was a good burger!!

If I was a local, I know I would frequent this place. :) I look forward to the opportunity to come and eat and drink again!

Been here twice.  Once with family on a Saturday and another time with a buddy to catch up.  
First visit was subpar.  Although I enjoyed my meal the service was extremely slow and had to request our server a couple times. Could've been a one off due to the high volume at that time.  
The second was during the week, a Wednesday evening to be exact,  Ordered wings, pizza, and beer.  Food was what you'd expect from a brewery,  Chillies comes to mind.  They only serve their beer so don't get too fancy.  The roof top overlooking the Beltline is a nice option.  Have a drink, people watch, have more drinks.  Valet is the best option If I you are going to one of the establishments as they will validate and offset the cost difference from self park so that's a no braineR.  Check it out.
We had a big group so the food was catered and it was good. Their chips and queso was delicious and my favorite drink was the beach frozen drink.
Always love coming here to sit outside or on the rooftop when the weather permits! Food is great! Especially the Buffalo wings and Asian style lodes fries  Wasn't too crazy about the crab dip though.
Food was good and the rooftop was cool to chill at. Perfect spot to just hang and watch a game.
Great spot in a decent location. Beer flights had a good selection. Only con is there's no bar service on the rooftop bar on the weekends. This brewery is otherwise a hit!
The spot was great!  We dined here following a trip to the Illuminarium.  The food, service and live music were wonderful.

New Realm Brewing is right off the beltline not far down from Ponce City Market. After spending a few hours at Ponce City Market, we strolled to New Realm Brewing for some beer, pizza, and fries. This place is huge! It was extremely hot outside, so we choose indoor seating instead of going up to the rooftop. We made our own flight of about 6 different beers (all delicious), ordered a margarita pizza and some French fries. Everything tasted amazing! The server was kind and attentive. Definitely stop here if you're in the area! Good time guaranteed!

I came to New Realm Brewing for an event that was held here and my experience was awesome! The New Realm Brewery is located in a great location overlooking the Beltline and it also has a great view of the city of Atlanta. The food, service and beers were spot on! I enjoyed the mac and cheese, charcuterie, sliders, meatballs (yum!!!) and the bacon grilled cheese, and let me not forget the desserts they offered! The bartenders and the servers were very friendly and professional and actually took their time explaining the beers and food to me. This place will be my new go-to hangout spot for hanging outdoors while sipping the variety of beers. 

For the beers I tried the Euphonia, The Commissioner, and the Perun and all of them were great! However, the Perun was my favorite. Below I have listed the three beers I tasted and their descriptions:

* The Euphonia is a Pilsner - German 5% ABV. Hop bursted with noble & new-school hop varieties. Crisp, dry, with vibrant hop aroma.

* The Commissioner is a Blond Ale - Belgian Blond 5% ABV. This easy-drinking Belgian-influenced blond ale was the first beer brewed to commission their package lines. Light malt character, fruitiness & clove from the Belgian yeast. Very crisp and refreshing.

* Perun is a Pale Ale - American 5.5% ABV. A homage to the style that created craft beer. Citrus and pine, with a touch of caramel maltiness. 


I will definitely return here and enjoy the beers again and their food! On top of New Realm, they are dog friendly! Cheers!

The food was SO GOOD which I wasn't expecting for a brewery. The beer was a little more limited than I would've liked, but I was blown away with the food. The hard seltzer selection was prettty good for a brewery but I would've liked to have more sours. The environment is awesome- would highly recommend going upstairs for drinks and a good view. It is a large space and very clean. If you're looking for someone fun with good service this is the place!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for sharing! Seltzers are new for us, so we are truly trying to get them just right.

comment.text:
Awesome venue, better location, but food and beer left a lot to be desired! 

Visited New Realm for the first time on a Saturday around noon and needless to say it was already jam packed with sun seekers, beer lovers and furry pet owners!

My husband is a self proclaimed beer connoisseur, so we're constantly frequenting breweries and chasing after new releases. He didn't have high expectations for the beer based on previous remarks from the craft beer community, however I went in with no expectations and hoped for the best. Sadly the beer lacked punch, flavor and overall a limited variety. I tend to be attracted to sour beers and dark stouts and their coffee porter was the closest I was going to get to my preferred flavor palette. 

As for the food, I ordered the Tucker Farms Green salad with an add on of the Blackened Shrimp.  ($19) My husband ordered the Gluten Free Red Quinoa with Beer Can Pulled Chicken. ($20) Both were tasty, but Uber small portions. The Tucker salad was supposed to be accompanied by heirloom tomatoes, kalamata olive, shishito peppers and mozzarella cheese but I could barely find them. 

Would probably only revisit if in the area ..

photos.caption: Tucker Farms' Green with Blackened Shrimp

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Jasmine,

Thank you for the review and feedback.  Sorry to hear our beers weren't to you liking.  Although we don't have sours yet, we have new styles coming out each week.  

Hope to have you back again soon

Don

comment.text: Great area, right on the belt line. Excellent beer and drink selection. People watching top notch. Live music was the best I've encountered. Really enjoyed sitting outside listening to the music and watching People cruise by. Could spend all day here.

I've seen New Realm many times while walking on the BeltLine but never thought to eat there. They always have a diverse crowd in the evenings, but I'm not a beer drinker so I never thought to stop by. My coworkers and I decided to go for lunch one day and I'm glad we did! 

We were greeted by the hostess and immediately seated. I ordered a kale Caesar salad, usually a romaine and kale salad, but I asked for all kale. I also added the beer can pulled chicken. 

My salad came out perfectly! I wasn't sure how I'd like pulled chicken on a Caesar salad but it was pretty good. I'm picky when it comes to croutons when ordering salads because they are typically stale, but these were fresh and flavorful! Overall, the salad was fresh, the caesar dressing was good, and the pulled chicken was flavorful. My only feedback would to be have an option for grilled chicken on the menu. 

One of my coworkers had the Radegast Burger, he said it's one of the best burgers he's had! There were 5 of us and we all enjoyed our lunch and agreed we would go back.

So if you aren't a beer drinker, don't count New Realm out. They have great food and great service.

photos.caption: Kale Caesar salad with beer can pulled chicken

comment.text: Had the good fortune to eat here today. Loved the low key casual atmosphere. The service and food was excellent!
Great food. Great drinks. Tons of seating spaces in different environments as well. Know your table number when you want to order and sit outside!

New Realm is a super fun place to go with friends or on a date whether it's a Saturday night or a Monday afternoon. It is ALWAYS crowded and has a wait, but I think it's worth it. The outdoor seating is first come first serve so be sure to get there early on weekends to get a table for your group. Their pizzas and Mac and cheese are outstanding! The view from the rooftop is so pretty of the belt line but if you're COVID conscious I wouldn't recommend going up there.
Lovvvvved this bloody! They make the mix in house. More of a tomato taste than a olive taste, which I prefer. Perfect level of heat to keep your warm inside on a cold day.

New Realm brokered an excellent spot on the Eastside Beltline and has marketed it's location better than any other establishment on the trail with the exception of Ponce City Market.

I'm all in with the layout of the establishment. It promotes social interaction and utilization of the outdoor space very well. I almost forget it's a brewery after a while especially given the fact they sell food. And it's very apparent someone invested in the facility a great deal. The metal works all over the place, comfy furniture and decor. It's definitely a chill spot. Would love to get a hold of the general contractor that organized the construction of the place.

HOWEVER! 
My first pass at New Realm isn't 5*. In particular, the brews aren't my favorites. Not to be a beer snob, I just didn't find one with mainstay power. And to be clear, the brews aren't disgusting by any means, but I'm not sure I'll have NR pours in my rotation. Therefore, since NR is a brewery that sells beer (hello), my enjoyment of it is predicated on the beer. While the facility is damn nice, it lacks the (frequent) return factor for me without a beer I can write home about.

Came here in January for a friend's birthday and had a really nice time! The servers are attentive and the ambiance is great. They were relatively busy but were still able to accommodate me and 6 of my friends very quickly! The food was also great and I loved my burger. The portions are a decent size but nothing too big. A couple of basketball games were on and some of the guys wanted to watch it so the server lowered the screens and turned the game on to the one we wanted to watch which was awesome. I'll definitely come back here!
The food is really good and comes out relatively fast. it is my favorite restaurant on the beltline and there is an amazing view lol

They allow you to bring your pups with you to eat. Which is perfect for when walking on the belt line. Came for lunch had birria tacos. Always wanted to try them. Came with corn Mexican style. The corn was amazing. Tacos had a strong cinnamon taste that I didn't care for too much but they were prepared well. Beer selection was wide. Had to try a few before selecting a summer brew. Tasted amazing and refreshing.

Visited New Realm for a corporate event on a weekday evening! We booked out the roof top, had an open bar and a buffet. The food and views were incredible. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable about the beer. I asked for a beer that belonged to another brewing company  and they didn't make me feel embarrassed... lol. He just let me know that they only carry New Realm beers and suggested something similar. Overall, fun place... every time I walk by on the belt line, the roof top is poppin/there is a band playing.

What an awesome experience!! Beer was fantastic, staff was great, food was delicious. All around a great place. 

Definitely sit on the rooftop! The vibes and view of the ATL skyline up there are amazing. Also try the B-ATL!!!!

I went here on a Friday night and we sat outside on the patio. I was a little concerned about social distancing as the patio was PACKED. There was even a wedding party going on with a ton of people. I do however give the view, and location 5 stars. Our waiter was pretty nice. The food was okay but I was very disappointed that they didn't have a full bar to serve things like wine, long islands, etc. I ended up ordering a cranberry and vodka which tasted like merely juice. The dinner menu seemed very limited as well. Nonetheless, I think it's a pretty good restaurant and I probably will return on maybe a weeknight when there's less going on.
This place is just massive, beautiful brewery and a huge selection of beer to choose from!!!

We wanted to go and have some food and drinks, so we opted to go to New Realm.  We had been there a few times before and enjoyed it.  The server was great (can't remember her name). The food was a bit less great the times past. I had the turkey sandwich and it was better the first time.  The cocktails were not as good as the beer, we had the tropical dream!  It was delicious.  We even got a six pack to take home!

I was so excited to bring my good friend to what is normally a great experience. Wings were tiny! Burgers were dry (I KNOW! They are normally epic!), and server wouldn't even bring us napkins. 

So very disappointed. Lower your expectations on Saturday patio afternoon.

Such a great spot to stop at on the belt line, and I love their food menu too! It's a great gathering spot for a drink or even dinner. My only feedback is that it gets BUSY, seriously no joke, it's gets crowded and especially with COVID, it's a little uncomfortable. There is plenty of outdoor seating but I recommend getting there before rush periods!

Server forgot to bring my one (1) beer (after about 20+ minutes) and I had to ask another server to find her for me and remind her. This was well-before the lunch crowd and the restaurant was not that busy.  The server was then snarky later on when the check was presented and my dining parter and I were deciding how to pay.  The server said in a not so friendly way "yeah, I'm really busy so you need to decide..."

Disappointing that you can't get a sip of a beer to taste before purchasing.  Unless you want to pay $4.00 or so for a few ounces.

The beer I got was good....but turned out it was one of those tiny beers at a regular beer price because of the alcohol content.  Right.

Not very customer friendly or customer-focused.

Found it over-priced in general.

And you have to pay to park there.

I don't think I'll be going back anytime soon.
